intro: Hydrochorea corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered water aster, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in tropical regions. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, enhancing its ability to retain moisture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the summer months. Its root system is adapted to waterlogged soils, making it an important species in aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems. Hydrochorea corymbosa plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
